title: We are fantastic, are we?
description: Chapter of the book "De la estabilidad al equilibrio inestable", published by the Department of Political Science - UdelaR.
contents:
In this chapter we analyzed the Uruguayan political system from a comparative perspective. We showed that our system is less volatile and less fragmented than almost any other on the region. On the contrary, it is the most ideologically polarized. Looking for a temporal trend, we find a growing pattern in all of them.
ISBN 978-9974-8594-3-2

Cite Bibtex

title: COVID-19 y elecciones subnacionales en Uruguay
description: Chapter of the book "La democracia a prueba. Los años que votamos en pandemia en las Américas", published by Universidad Nacional de Rosario.
contents:
In this chapter we use a rational choice approach to analyze the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic on the 2020 Uruguayan sub-national elections turnout.
ISBN 978-987-813-093-4

title: Coordinación Electoral y Doble Voto Simultáneo
description: In my undergraduate thesis I studied the electoral coordination process on the subnational level in Uruguay.
